meanings.sent1: The bread had a grainy texture from the seeds inside.
meanings.sent2: The sand on the beach felt grainy under my feet.
meanings.sent3: The grainy soil looked like tiny dots sprinkled on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded grainy, like sandpaper rubbing against wood.
meanings.sent5: The grainy image on the old TV made it hard to see clearly.

meanings.sent1: The rough paper felt grainy against my fingertips.
meanings.sent2: The tree bark was grainy to the touch, causing splinters.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tongue felt grainy as it licked my hand.
meanings.sent4: The grainy surface of the rock scratched my skin.
meanings.sent5: The grainy fabric of the blanket made it uncomfortable to sleep on.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling grains or granules
meanings.sent1: The sugar was grainy, not smooth like powdered sugar.
meanings.sent2: The salt crystals were large and grainy in the shaker.
meanings.sent3: The grainy powder spilled everywhere when she opened the bag.
meanings.sent4: The grainy texture of the cereal made it crunchy and delicious.
meanings.sent5: The grainy appearance of the granite gave it a unique and natural look.
